intro: Euploca inexplicita, commonly known as the obscure euploca, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or along streambanks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Euploca inexplicita is considered a species of conservation concern.
